page.title: 05Social Services in Kensworth
page.content: There is neither a doctors surgery nor a chemist in the area, which means travelling to Dunstable or Markyate to visit or get a prescription made up which is often difficult for the elderly and those without a car. However,the area is covered by District Nurses,Home-helps and Meals on Wheels,the latter organised by the Womens Royal Voluntary Service and manned by voluntary drivers.The meals are cooked at "Steppingstones" Dunstable.There is a travelling Baby Clinic which calls fortnightly in Kensworth in connection with the Mothers and Toddlers Group.There is also a visiting chiropodist.The travelling County Library comes around the area fortnightly and in Kensworth library books are taken to housebound people by a volunteer.The nearest hospital is Luton & Dunstable.
